reqs: This course examines art movements that begin with the Group of Seven and nationalist landscape painting, and concludes with the Vancouver school of photo-based contemporary art. The major art movements are discussed, as well as the achievements of significant artists, including First Nations' artists whose work intersects with Western art. The course charts the twists and turns taken by traditional media, notably painting and photography, and examines the significance of installation work and video. It also looks at how historical events, patronage and art institutions have shaped the visual arts in Canada during a period marked by social upheaval and technological change.
courseName: Art and Photography in Canada, 1920 to the Present
description: Art movements and art institutions from the landscape paintings of the Group of Seven to the photo-conceptualist practices of the Vancouver school.
